newsitem.title: UK: US stocks up in London after upbeat press reports.
newsitem.headline: US stocks up in London after upbeat press reports.

text.p: U.S. stocks were firmer across the board in London on Monday after a weekend of fairly upbeat press reports about the prospects for U.S. stocks, dealers said.
Technology shares led the rise, with Microsoft Corp adding $3/8 TO $117-1/8.
The Wall Street Journal reported that said the software giant is expected to announce agreements with two companies to allow users of terminals hooked up to a server computer to run most PC programs.
Shares in Hewlett-Packard Co climbed $1/4 to $54-1/4 ahead of the company's results, due later this week.

Shares in Intel Corp and International Business Machines Corp (IBM) each firmed $3/8 to $159-7/8 and $167-7/8 respectively after IBM and others said they saw no major impact from the flaw in one of Intel's computer chips.
Bucking the firmer trend were shares in Philip Morris Inc, which slipped $1/4 to $41-3/4 on press reports suggesting that tobacco talks could hit a snag over liability.
Elsewhere, WMX Technologies Inc shares rose $3/8 to $31 after the group raised its dividend and said it would choose a new chief executive at its annual meeting on Friday.
Shares in fast-food giant McDonald's Corp bounced $1/4 in London to $53-1/4, after tumbling $1-1/4 in New York on Friday.
June S&P 500 futures were up 1.25 points at 830.90 on Globex at 1055 GMT, while June long bond futures were off 1/32 at 110-6/32.

Dealers said they expected to Dow to open eight to 10 points firmer ahead of this week's raft of economic data, which include consumer and wholesale prices and retail sales. --London Newsroom +44 171 542 5106
